title: A Quantitative Single-cell Flow Cytometry Assay for Retrograde Membrane Trafficking Using Engineered Cholera Toxin
procedures: Protein purificationCholera toxin B subunit (CTB) is cloned into a pET28a vector (Clontech). mNG211 is fused to cholera toxin A2 strand and cloned into pGEXTEV-SUMO vector. The construct contains an N-terminal GST tag to facilitate purification of CTB-mNG211 and a SUMO protease cleavage site to allow removal of the GST-SUMO tag.Perform co-transformation of CTB pET28a and mNG211-CTA2 pGEXTEV-SUMO plasmids into Shuffle T7 Express E. coli according to manufacturer’s High Efficiency Transformation protocol. Dilute transformed bacteria in SOC (typically 1:10) and spread 50-100 μl on a prewarmed LB agar plate (containing 100 μg/ml ampicillin, 50 μg/ml kanamycin).Grow transformed Shuffle T7 Express cells for 16-24 h on an LB agar in a 30 °C incubator.The next day, restreak the transformed cells onto a new an LB agar plate (containing 100 μg/ml ampicillin, 50 μg/ml kanamycin) and regrow overnight at 30 °C.Inoculate 100 ml 2x YT (supplemented with 100 μg/ml ampicillin, 50 μg/ml kanamycin) and incubate for 3-5 h at 35 °C, shaking at 225 rpm.Note: Make -80 °C glycerol stock for future use. Add 500 μl of the overnight culture to 500 μl 50% glycerol in a 2 ml cryogenic vial and store at -80 °C. Measure the OD600nm of the starter culture and inoculate a larger 500 ml of 2x YT (supplemented with 100 μg/ml ampicillin, 50 μg/ml kanamycin) to obtain an initial OD600nm of approximately 0.05-0.1.Incubate at 35 °C, shaking at 225 rpm and measure OD600nm every 30-60 min until 1.0-1.2 is obtained. This should take approximately 3-5 h.Induce cells by adding a final concentration of 0.4 mM IPTG and incubate for 16-20 h at 18 °C, shaking at 225 rpm.Harvest cells by transferring culture to 500 ml centrifuge bottle and centrifuging at 5,000 x g for 10 min at 4 °C.

Discard the supernatant and process the pellets as quickly as possible to minimize insoluble products. Keep the sample on ice to prevent protein degradation.Resuspend pellet in 30 ml lysis buffer by pipetting and briefly vortexing. Ensure that no pellet remains.Meanwhile, prepare glutathione agarose resin:Swirl container and transfer glutathione agarose resin (1 ml for 8 mg GST-tagged protein) to a 50 ml tube.Resuspend up to 30 ml in ice-cold Milli-Q water, spin at 300 x g for 1 min at 4 °C. Aspirate of Milli-Q water.Resuspend up to 30 ml in ice-cold binding buffer, spin at 300 x g for 1 min at 4 °C. Aspirate of binding buffer.Store washed glutathione agarose resin in 5 ml binding buffer at 4 °C or on ice until use.Homogenize cells with emulsifier:Place cooling coil on ice.Add sample resuspended in lysis buffer to Avestin emulsifier.Continuously homogenize sample with pressure fluctuating around 5,000 psi.Transfer lysate to a 50 ml tube and centrifuge at 15,000 x g for 10 min at 4 °C to pellet debris.Transfer supernatant to a new 50 ml tube and discard the pellet. Add washed Glutathione Resin to the cleared lysate and incubate at 4 °C for 1 h with gentle end-over-end rotation.Transfer slurry to an Econo-Pac column and allow the sample to settle.Wash beads three times each with 5 column volumes of binding buffer.Elute protein by adding 5 column volumes of elution buffer directly to the glutathione agarose resin.Determine protein concentration by measuring the A280nm using a NanoDrop 2000 spectrophotometer. An absorbance of 1.0 unit equates to a protein concentration of 1.0 mg/ml for CTB-mNG211 (extinction coefficient: 58,955 M-1 cm-1).Add ULP1 protease to obtain a ULP1:CTB-mNG211 ratio of 1:10 w/w by weight.Transfer eluted protein containing ULP1 protease to a SnakeSkin Dialysis tubing as instructed by the manufacturer.

Dialyze overnight at 4 °C in 1 L Dialysis Buffer, continuously stirred.Next day, discard the external buffer and dialyze for 3 h at 4 °C in 1 L Buffer A, continuously stirred.Collect the dialyzed protein and filter through a 0.45 μm filter unit into a new 50 ml tube.Perform cation exchange using Hi-Trap SP HP column according to the manufacturer’s purification protocol using continuous ionic strength gradient to elute purified protein.Bio-Rad NGC Quest10 Plus Chromatography system.Load the protein onto the column pre-equilibrated with Buffer A at a flow rate of 1 ml/min at 4 °C using the sample pump.Wash the column with 5 column volumes of buffer A at a flow rate of 1 ml/min at 4 °C.Elute the column with 15 column volumes of continuously increasing percentage of buffer B (0-80%) at a flow rate of 1 ml/min at 4 °C. Collecte single 0.5-1 ml fractions in 5 ml round-bottom polystyrene tubes.Load 20 μl of each fraction and analyze by Tris-Glycine SDS-PAGE (see Notes) and stain the gel with Coomassie blue reagent. Molecular weight of CTB monomer = 11.6 kDa. Molecular weight of mNG211-CTA2 = 7.8 kDa. Recombinant GST-SUMO and ULP1 elutes in the flow-through fractions.Note: Visualization of CTA2-mNG211 can be challenging to observe by Tris-Glycine SDS-PAGE. Tris-Tricine SDS-PAGE enables better separation of small molecular weight proteins. However, it is not critical to perform this step as CTA2-NG211 co-elutes with CTB if purification was performed correctly. Identify and combine fractions containing purified CTB-mNG211. Determine the concentration of CTB-mNG211 by measuring the A280nm using a NanoDrop 2000 spectrophotometer.Aliquots are flash-frozen using liquid nitrogen and stored at -80 °C for future use. Freeze-thawing of CTB-mNG211 should be minimized and small aliquots (20-50 μl recommended volume) can be distributed into PCR 8-strip tubes.

Lentivirus production and cell-line transductionNote: Lentiviruses are classified as Biosafety Level 2 (BSL-2) organisms and thus appropriate measures and facilities are required to conduct experiments. Perform the following steps in a biosafety cabinet.ER-HA-mNG21-10 and Sec61β-HA-mNG21-10 constructs include a blasticidin selection marker and HA-tag for immunofluorescence detection using anti-HA primary antibody.Plate HEK 293T cells in a 6-well plate to obtain 80% confluency for 24 h before transfection.Transfect HEK 293T cells with lentivirus transfer plasmid (ER-HA-mNG21-10 or Sec61β-HA-mNG21-10), packaging plasmids (psPAX2 and pVSVG).Prepare 1.5 μg/well ER-HA-mNG21-10 (or Sec61β-HA-mNG21-10), 1 μg/well psPAX2, 0.5 μg/well pVSVG in 50 μl Opti-MEM.Prepare PEI at a ratio of 3:1 PEI:DNA in 50 μl Opti-MEM.Combine Opti-MEM containing plasmids and PEI together and incubate for 5-15 min at room temperature.Add the PEI/plasmid mix to wells in a dropwise manner, evenly distributing the mix over the well.Incubate for 4-6 h at 37 °C 5% CO2. Aspirate the media and replace with 2 ml fresh media (DMEM, 10% FBS). Incubate for 48 h at 37 °C 5% CO2 to allow HEK 293T cells to secrete the lentivirus into the culture media.Harvest the culture media containing the secreted lentivirus and store at 4 °C. Add fresh media and harvest again at 72 h following transfection.Combine the collected culture media and filter through a 0.45 μm filter. Lentivirus can be aliquoted and stored at -80 °C for future use.Culture your cell-line(s) of interest.Not all cell-lines bind Cholera Toxin. In addition, each cell line has a varying range of retrograde activity. HEK 293T, COS7 and K562 are validated lines for retrograde trafficking.Determine if your cell line of interest can at least bind cholera:Incubate cells with fluorescent 2 nm CTB-Alexa Fluor 488 for at least 30 min at 37 °C 5% CO2.

Wash cells, resuspend, and assay for CTB-Alexa Fluor 488 binding by flow cytometry as described below.Note: If cell line does not express sufficient GM1, cells can be pre-incubated with 2 μm GM1-C12:0 diluted in fatty-acid free BSA for 10 min at 37 °C. Synthesis of GM1-C12:0 is outlined in Chinnapen et al., 2012. Warm media, 1x PBS and trypsin in a water bath set to 37 °C.Note: We cultured K562 cells in RPMI + 10% FBS pen/strep and HEK 293T and COS7 cells in DMEM + 10% FBS pen/strep. When cells are approximately 60-80% confluent, aspirate off media, wash cells with 1x PBS, trypsinize, and resuspend in media. Split cells into a 6-well plate with each well containing 1 ml media.Transduce your cells with lentivirus:Add 1 ml virus/polybrene to a 6-well plate containing 1 ml media containing cells.Final polybrene concentration at 5 μg/ml to filtered virus.Incubate at 37 °C 5% CO2 for 24 h.Aspirate off media and replace with fresh growth media and incubate for an additional day. Time may vary according to how quickly cell lines recover and grow.Next day collect cells in 15 ml tube, centrifuge at 1,000 x g for 30 s and aspirate off media.Resuspend cells in 5 ml media and transfer cells to a T25 flask (or a 60 mm culture dish).Select for transduced cells expressing ER-HA-mNG21-10 or Sec61β-HA-mNG21-10 with blasticidin. Optimal blasticidin concentration should be predetermined by testing drug toxicity in parental cells.Plate parental cells in a 6-well plate to obtain ~50% confluency the next day.Add final blasticidin concentrations ranging between 2 μg/ml and 100 μg/ml.Observe selection process to monitor the optimal concentration of blasticidin required to kill > 90% of the cells typically within 3-14 days.Use the predetermined concentration for selection of transduced cells.

Assay validation by confocal imagingNote: Perform the following cell culture steps in a biosafety cabinet. If necessary, collagen coat coverslips. Add 150 μl collagen diluted in 70% ethanol to coverslip placed in a 12-well plate. Allow to completely airdry in the biosafety cabinet.Plate cells (DMEM, 10% FBS, pen/strep) on coverslips to obtain ~80% confluency the next day. Incubate cells at 37 °C 5% CO2.Next day replace cells with fresh growth media.Treat cells with 20 nm CTB-mNG211 and incubate for 6 h at 37 °C 5% CO2.Note: PFA should be handled in a chemical fume hood. Aspirate media, and fix cells with 1 ml 4% paraformaldehyde (PFA) in 1x PBS and incubate at room temperature for 20-60 min.Aspirate off PFA, wash twice with 1 ml 1x PBS and permeabilize with 1 ml 0.2% saponin 1x PBS.Block with 1 ml 5% goat serum in 0.2% saponin 1x PBS for 1 h at room temperature.Aspirate off blocking solution and apply 500 μl diluted primary antibody (1x PBS, 0.2% saponin), incubate overnight at 4 °C.Note: ER-HA-mNG21-10 and Sec61β-HA-mNG21-10 localization can be assessed using anti-HA antibody (diluted 1:500). Rinse three times with 1 ml 1x PBS + 0.2% saponin for 3-5 min each time.Apply 500 μl diluted secondary Alexa Fluor antibody (1x PBS, 0.2% saponin) for 1 h at room temperature.Note: Goat anti-rat Alexa Fluor 488 secondary antibody was applied at 1:500. Rinse twice with 1 ml 1x PBS + 0.2% saponin and once with 1 ml 1x PBS for 3-5 min.Mount coverslip face down on slide using mountant and allow to cure overnight at room temperature protected from light.Note: For long-term storage, store slides at 4 °C protected from light. Slides can be assessed by confocal imaging according to the manufacturer’s operation manual.

Flow cytometryNote: Perform the following cell culture steps in a biosafety cabinet. Retrograde transport assessed by flow cytometry can be adapted based on your experimental conditions.Note: Poorly maintained cells will affect retrograde trafficking. Use cells between 2 and 3 days since the last passage. Adherent Cells:Plate 24-well plate to obtain ~80% confluency or experimental conditions necessary pertaining to your experiment.The next day, aspirate and replace with fresh growth media.Add 20 nm CTB-mNG211. Working 100x concentration of CTB-mNG211 can be prepared using serum free media or 1x PBS and kept on ice. Use within 24 h for each aliquot.Incubate cells at 37 °C, 5% CO2 for 4-6 h if testing for the first time.Wash cells, trypsinize cells and add FACS buffer and transfer to an Eppendorf or flow cytometry test tube. Keep cells on ice and process quickly. Alternatively, cells can be fixed with 4% PFA for 20 min, washed and resuspend in FACS buffer. PFA fixation will help sustain the GFP signal.Note: We have not noticed trypsinization to grossly effect final overall fluorescent signal but quick processing of samples by chilling on ice or fixation is recommended. Suspension Cells:Count cells to 1 x 105-5 x 105 cells/ml and transfer 0.5 ml/condition into round bottom 96-well deep-well plates. Cell density and volumes can be adjusted based on cell-line and experimental interest.Add 20 nm CTB-mNG211. 100x Working concentration of CTB-mNG211 can be prepared from stock aliquots using serum free media or 1x PBS. Protein is kept on ice before use. Use proteins within 24 h of thawing.Incubate cells at 37 °C, 5% CO2 for 4-6 h if testing for the first time.Spin down cells, wash with 1xPBS and resuspend in FACS buffer. Fix cells as above if desired.

Cells can be passed through a 40 μm strainer for single-cell suspension if an issue.Vortex briefly and perform flow cytometry with the BD LSRFortessaTM Flow cytometer system according to the manufacturer’s operation manual and experimental needs.
